Create a community calendar where residents can post upcoming events or safety concerns. This will help everyone stay informed and connected.
Host a neighborhood potluck where residents can get to know each other and build relationships. This will create a sense of community and make people more likely to work together for their safety.
Organize a block party where residents can come together to celebrate and have fun. This will help break down barriers between neighbors and encourage them to be more involved in their community.
Start a neighborhood blog or social media group where residents can share information about suspicious activity or ask for advice on how to keep their homes safe.

Create a neighborhood safety survey that asks residents what they think could be done to improve safety in their area. This will give residents a voice and allow them to suggest solutions that are tailored to their needs.
